Comment: Their voting shouldn't be relevant. Why does someone in rural Oklahoma, desperate for any opportunities, getting barraged by right-wing media saying Trump will make things better vote that way. Because they are too focused on surviving day to day to question it. If one cannot empathize with them, cannot talk to them to shift their perspective or provide the information that they need then of course they are going to vote for Trump. They feel and largely have been abandoned by politicians so are the perfect targets for charlatans. Empathy and being willing to talk from their perspective is the key to starting to shift people away from Trump. Otherwise if you don't they will stay there and even gain supporters as people identify with the group being demeaned. Genuinely how radical right-wing movements tend to gain traction and support is the feel of marginalization and the way to break them up is indeed Empathy and discussion showing them the otherside isn't evil just human.

Comment: The problem with that view that you have is it pushes people toward the conservatives and Trump. Not saying you have to like these people. But haven't empathy, being able to talk to these people from a perspective they can understand is important to turning them toward your side to moving people across the aisle. These are desperate people in a very low income area who are focused largely on day to day survival. Them getting very little news and being told Trump will change things make America rich that is a message desperate people on a sinking ship will latch onto. Talking to people is the key. The black man who manages to get hundreds of KKK to leave the clan did so by simply talking, empathizing with people who would normally hate him, sometimes that is what it takes to shift people. Calling them morons, ignoring the economic realities that they face, that pushes people away to continue with Trump as the other side is belittling them. Again the grifters and wealthy patrons around Trump they know what they do and cannot really be reasoned with direct your hate there as they also provide the disinformation that is manipulating the poor and desperate in this country to go against their own interests.

Author: ElderSmackJack

Comment: You talk to them to their interests. Sanders whether you agree with him or not has done very well even in these areas as he talks with people to their problems. Some people are indeed too stubborn, hateful, or ignorant to reach. But a lot of people who voted Trump are the victims of right wing media campaigns compounded by the general fact that the average Americans lives have gotten worse and the messaging they get is that the existing political class has stolen from them ergo the preference for perceived outsiders like trump. Is it smart no but again people who are barely surviving day to day don't have the time to get informed ergo why talking to them, empathizing with them, being able to get messages through to them is important. This is a war that the democrats are losing they  may have campaigned to bring Republicans across the aisle but only at high level and not really communicating at the grass roots. This is something that has to be worked constantly not just during an election season and why democrats have lost and continue to be completely pushed out of red states as the national establishment basically gave up on local parties so they don't get the resources to do basic outreach.
Author: cjh42
